story:
Dear child, come close to Mama and snuggle in tight. Tonight, I have a special story just for you.

Once upon a time, in a small village surrounded by blooming bamboo forests and misty mountains, there lived a little dragon named Ling. Ling was unlike any other dragon you've ever heard of. She was small, no bigger than a housecat, and her scales shone like the brightest jewels. But what made Ling truly special was her wings â€“ they shimmered with a soft, golden light that could ward off any darkness.

Ling loved to explore the world beyond her village, to dance in the sunbeams that filtered through the leaves, and to play hide-and-seek among the tall rice stalks. But as the days grew shorter and the nights grew darker, Ling began to notice that the villagers were scared. They whispered stories of a terrible creature that roamed the night, a creature that could snatch children from their beds and never return them.

Ling knew she had to do something to help her friends. She asked the wise old tortoise, Wu, who lived in the nearby temple, what she could do. Wu smiled and said, "Ah, little one, your golden wings can light the way for the villagers. Use your powers to chase the darkness away!"

So, Ling spread her wings and soared into the night sky, her golden light illuminating the village. The villagers gasped in wonder as the darkness receded, and the air filled with the sweet scent of blooming flowers. The children laughed and played, their fears forgotten.

As the night wore on, Ling grew tired, her wings weakening. She settled back into her cozy little nest, made of soft silk and feathers, in the heart of the temple. Wu appeared once more, smiling, and whispered, "Your work is done, little one. Your light will always be needed, but for now, rest and sleep soundly, knowing you've kept the village safe."

And so, Ling closed her eyes and drifted off to sleep, her golden wings folded tightly around her, shining softly in the moonlight.

Now, my dear child, it's time for you to go to sleep too. Close your eyes and imagine Ling's golden wings guiding you through your dreams. Remember, your own light, though it may be small, can shine brightly and chase away the darkness. Keep your heart full of kindness and compassion, just like Ling, and you will always be a source of warmth and comfort to those around you.

Goodnight, my little one. May your sleep be sweet and your dreams be filled with the magic of Ling, the little dragon who brings light to the world.

Mama loves you.
